snippet: The movement by dieters away from calorie-counting, for instance, has hurt Special K, which over the years expanded to include snack bars, crackers and frozen waffles.
abstract: Kellogg's reports second-quarter earnings of $295 million, or 82 cents per share, down 16 percent from previous year; cites declining cereal sales as Special K brand falls out of fashion with dieters.
lead_paragraph: The movement by dieters away from calorie-counting, for instance, has hurt Special K, which over the years expanded to include snack bars, crackers and frozen waffles.

headline.main: Kellogg Profit Falls 16% on Sluggish Cereal Sales
headline.print_headline: Kellogg Profit Falls 16% on Sluggish Cereal Sales
